title: Make a Bone Knife
brief: Create a puncturing tool from animal bone by shattering and shaping bone splinters.
steps: Step 1: Select a large bone such as a leg bone from a deer or medium-sized animal.
Step 2: Place the bone on a hard surface and shatter it by hitting with a heavy rock.
Step 3: Select a suitable pointed splinter from the pieces.
Step 4: Shape and sharpen the splinter by rubbing it on a rough-surfaced rock.
Step 5: If the piece is too small to handle safely, lash it securely to a hardwood handle.
warnings: Use bone knives ONLY for puncturing - they will not hold an edge.
Bone may flake or break if used for slashing or chopping.
Handle carefully as bone splinters can be very sharp but brittle.
